I could tell that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not have been millions of dollars rich or famous as big studio directors are but they really cared about their work. You can tell every frame of this movie is seen through a lens with love and passion.

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
Takes its sweet time meandering through the plot, but we do get minutes and minutes of John Turturro with an Italian accent on his knees. We also see him plow over a young Victor Hugo in the bedroom without his keyboard!! :P

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may think that there was a lot of nudity in the film. Yes, there are scenes with naked men or partial nudity and this may turn away prospective viewers who do not want exposure of body parts as much as the story with its characters is presented and told.
